bank.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a business that keeps and lends money and provides other financial services
bank.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: We have very little money in the bank.
bank.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a local office of a bank
bank.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: I have to go to the bank at lunch time.
bank.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: land along the side of a river or lake
bank.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: the banks of the River Dee
bank.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: a large mass of clouds, mist etc
bank.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: a large sloping mass of earth, sand, snow etc
bank.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: She was sitting on a grassy bank.
bank.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: a large number of machines, television screens etc arranged close together in a row
bank.translation[0].definitions[6].defin: a supply of money used to gamble, that people can win
bank.translation[0].definitions[7].defin: a slope made at a bend in a road or racetrack to make it safer for cars to go around
bank.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: I went to the bank and took out $80.
You may be able to borrow some money from the bank.
The bank lent me £10,000 to help me start the business.
How much do you have in your bank account at the moment?
I'm just going to check my bank balance online.
You can  withdraw money using your bank card.
Will I have to pay bank charges on this account?
He began his career as a bank clerk.
What's the interest rate on your bank loan?
I get a written bank statement once a month.
Could I make an appointment with the bank manager, please?
The bank robbers were never caught.
There's a lot of competition between the major high street banks.
the role of UK commercial banks in the debt crisis
Goldman Sachs, the US investment bank
large commercial customers of the clearing banks
The Bundesbank is the central bank of Germany.
The road building was funded by the World Bank.
bank.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to put or keep money in a bank
bank.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to keep your money in a particular bank
bank.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: I’ve always banked at First Interstate.
bank.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: if a plane banks, it slopes to one side when turning
bank.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: The plane banked, and circled back toward us.
bank.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: to arrange something into a pile or into rows
bank.translation[1].definitions[3].examp: Snow was banked up on either side of the road.
bank.translation[1].definitions[4].defin: to form a mass of cloud, mist etc
bank.translation[1].definitions[5].defin: to cover a fire with wood or coal to keep it going for a long time
bank.translation[1].definitions[5].examp: Josie banked up the fire to last till morning.
bank.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: the BANK OF ENGLAND, Britain’s central bank
bank.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: The Bank is worried that strong demand for labour could lead to higher wages and prices.
bank.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: a business that makes its profit by paying interest to people who keep money there and charging a higher rate of interest to borrowers who borrow money from the bank. Different types of bank provide a variety of other financial services
bank.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: The major banks have announced an increase in interest rates.
bank.translation[3].definitions[1].defin: the local branch of a particular bank
bank.translation[3].definitions[1].examp: I have to go to the bank at lunchtime.
bank.translation[3].definitions[2].defin: to cost or need so much money that a person or organization is unable to pay
bank.translation[3].definitions[2].examp: customers who want to get a reasonable PC without breaking the bank
bank.translation[3].definitions[3].defin: a store of something that can be used when needed
bank.translation[4].definitions[0].defin: to put or keep money in a bank
bank.translation[4].definitions[0].examp: He banked rather than spent $3,800 in tax refunds.
bank.translation[4].definitions[1].defin: to keep your money in a particular bank
bank.translation[4].definitions[1].examp: Some families have banked with Hoare since the 17th century.
